"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c1c7fb636872702a221800#post_54c1c7fb636872702a221800
That;s my issue with alot of manga. They never...end.

And it's not like super hero comics/ western comics where it's multiple stories that have endings. These are just ongoing plotlines...for years. Each. week. (well, usually)

You miss a year. BETTER GET SOME TIME TO READ 15 new volumes buddy!


One piece gets a pass from this cause it is a bunch of stories, with one overall simple myth arc.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c1c9176368727ebf760200#post_54c1c9176368727ebf760200
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c1c7fb636872702a221800#post_54c1c7fb636872702a221800
That;s my issue with alot of manga. They never...end.

And it's not like super hero comics/ western comics where it's multiple stories that have endings. These are just ongoing plotlines...for years. Each. week. (well, usually)

You miss a year. BETTER GET SOME TIME TO READ 15 new volumes buddy!


One piece gets a pass from this cause it is a bunch of stories, with one overall simple myth arc. [/bq]
*runs to nuclear bunker to hide from comic book fans*
That's personally why I could never get into comic books or super hero stuff cause there's no fucking way I'm staying with a series for twenty fucking years before it finally ends.  Sure I'll watch the movies; just holy shit if people think I'm going to stay with a franchise for twenty years non-stop and buy every single comic they are massively mistaken.  I utterly do not have a twenty year attention span.
